basics.name: Julie Belrose
basics.label: Full-Stack Developer (Node.js / Angular – Back-End Oriented)
basics.summary: Full-stack developer with 2 years of experience in a fast-growing SaaS startup and currently in advanced application development training (M2I).
basics.summary_second: Experienced in full-cycle development and passionate about emerging technologies, including AI and Cloud solutions.
basics.availability: Open to full-time position in Paris

work.name: UMI
work.summary: Developed SaaS applications for enterprise social networking, custom quizzes, and data automation using Angular, Node.js, and MongoDB within a growing startup.
responsibilities: Collaborated with senior developers to design and implement web applications using modern JavaScript frameworks
Developed key modules for five microservice applications using Express.js (Node.js) for the back-end and Angular (v8–14) for the front-end
Optimized performance in Express.js microservices: improved error handling and query efficiency
Designed and maintained databases using Mongoose and MongoDB, creating robust schemas
Implemented full features: notification system, dynamic PDF generation via EJS, Excel export
Paired programming to build a notification system for a social platform
Created interactive charts (via Chart.js) for user dashboards with real-time API data integration
Applied clean code practices, conducted code reviews, manual testing, and documented technical incidents
Trained in TDD with Jest: practiced Test-Driven Development for both back-end and front-end using Jest
Agile : actively participated in Scrum ceremonies
achievements: Strategically refactored a complex front-end feature: optimized Angular code, reduced incidents by 98%, and improved user experience
Designed and implemented core business features (dynamic question types) for the main SaaS product
Created advanced reporting and analytics systems for market test data
Refactored critical Angular applications to eliminate production bugs and boost performance
Collaborated with UX/UI team to maintain visual coherence as Design System lead

volunteer.summary: Helped organize coding workshops and mentored new members.
highlights: Awarded 'Volunteer of the Month'

projects.name: Waste Reporting Application
projects.description: A fullstack group project built in Agile Scrum, enabling citizens, agents, and administrators to report and manage urban waste issues efficiently.
highlights: Currently developed in a 3-person team using Agile Scrum practices (sprints, stand-ups, retrospectives)
Fullstack web app: Node.js + Express.js backend, HTML/CSS/JS frontend
Domain-Driven Design (DDD) structure with clear separation of concerns (controller, service, entity, dto, mapper, schema)
Dual database support: MongoDB and MySQL
Environment-based configuration with .env for dev/prod
Middleware for error handling, authentication, and 404 responses
Commitizen integration for standardized, semantic commit messages
Frontend structured with modular components, pages, and reusable styles

projects.name: Ticket Office
projects.description: A simple Java application to manage events and ticket reservations through a console menu.
highlights: Manage clients, events and tickets with basic Create/Read/Update/Delete actions
Reserve tickets with seat categories (Standard, Gold, VIP) and capacity check
User-friendly menu with clear prompts to guide the interaction
Error handling with custom messages when data is missing or an event is full
Clean structure separating data, services, and user interface
Easily extendable: can be connected later to a database or a graphical interface

projects.name: Fashion Store Management API
projects.description: A Java back-end API for managing a fashion store’s inventory, customers, and sales, designed with a Domain-Driven Design inspired architecture.
highlights: Layered structure inspired by Domain-Driven Design principles
Dedicated packages for domain, dto, mapper, service, repository, and exception handling
Generic CRUD system (GenericCrud, GenericMapper, GenericCrudController) for reusable operations
DTO and Mapper layers to ensure clean separation between domain entities and API payloads
Robust exception handling with custom exceptions (e.g. FurnitureNotFoundException)
Full CRUD support for customers, products, carts, and sales
Enum-driven attributes for product categories and sales status
Extensible architecture that can evolve with new features or entities

projects.name: Mini Pokédex (React)
projects.description: A playful React project to search and filter Pokémon, with saved state between sessions.
highlights: Built a search feature that remembers the last Pokémon you looked for, even after refreshing the page
Used React hooks (useState, useEffect) to manage state and sync it with localStorage
Created a custom hook to make the localStorage logic reusable and cleaner
Implemented real-time filtering of Pokémon names and types, case-insensitive
Designed a simple but interactive UI with clear search, type filter, and empty state feedback

projects.name: Personal Portfolio
projects.description: A personal portfolio website to showcase my projects and skills.
highlights: Creation of Astro pages
Development of custom Astro components
Integration of a contact form using Web3form
Navigation bar implementation
Deployment via GitHub Pages with GitHub Actions

projects.name: O'clock Post-Training Service
projects.description: Design of a web platform connected to the O'clock API to support student follow-up after graduation.
highlights: Final training project
Support service for O'clock graduates
Tool to monitor 30 students per cohort, with 4 cohorts per month
Separate areas for students and administrators
Personalized follow-up for learners with cohort management
Session handling using cookies
OAuth 2.0-based authentication for secure access
Deployment on Heroku platform
